a.g: By the sun and its brightness
And [by] the moon when it follows it
And [by] the day when it displays it
And [by] the night when it covers it
And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
And [by] the earth and He who spread it
And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it
And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
He has succeeded who purifies it,

Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
Indeed, he has succeeded [aflaha] who purifies it [zakkaha], and he has failed [khaba] who corrupts it [dassaha]. And its success [falÄh] is only through righteous deeds [al-a'mÄl al-sÄliha], and the intellect [al-'aql] enlists the aid of the soul [al-nafs] in this commerce [tijÄra], for he employs it and subjugates it in that which purifies it, just as a merchant enlists the aid of his partner and his servant who trades with his wealth. And just as the partner can become an adversary, a contender who disputes with him over the profit, so he needs, first, to stipulate terms with him; second, to watch over him; third, to hold him to account; and fourth, to punish or reproach him. Likewise, the intellect [al-'aql] needs, first, to stipulate terms with the soul [al-nafs], so he imposes upon it the duties and stipulates for it the conditions, and guides it to the path of success [falÄh], and binds it firmly to the command of walking those paths. Then he must not be heedless of watching over it for an instant, for if he neglects it, he will see from it nothing but betrayal and the squandering of the capital, like the treacherous servant when the way is clear for him and he is left alone with the wealth. Then, after completion, he must hold it to account and demand from it the fulfillment of what was stipulated upon it. For this is a commerce [tijÄra] whose profit is the highest Paradise [al-Firdaws al-A'lÄ] and attainment of the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary [Sidrat al-MuntahÄ] with the Prophets and the martyrs. Therefore, meticulous accounting [hisÄb] in this with the soul [al-nafs] is far more important than meticulous accounting for the profits of the world [al-dunyÄ], even though they are contemptible in comparison to the bliss of the Hereafter [al-'uqba].

a.g: Thamud denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
When the most wretched of them was sent forth.
And the messenger of Allah [Salih] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allah or [prevent her from] her drink."
But they denied him and hamstrung her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
And He does not fear the consequence thereof.
